鋊字的基本解释

鋊
yù
铜屑：“今半两钱法重四铢，而奸或盗摩钱质而取鋊。”
器物用久渐渐磨光失去锋刃或棱：菜刀鋊了切不烂，剪刀鋊了剪不断。石磨已鋊了。
古代钩鼎耳和出炉炭的器具。

鋊字的汉语字典释义

[①]［yù］
［《廣韻》余蜀切，入燭，以。］
(1)铜屑。
(2)磨光。

鋊字的康熙字典解释

【戌集上】【金字部】　鋊； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页1307第02
【唐韻】余足切【集韻】【韻會】俞玉切，?音欲。【說文】可以鉤鼎及鑪炭。从金谷聲。【廣韻】炭鉤也。　又【說文】一曰銅屑。【前漢·食貨志】姦或盜摩錢質，以取鋊。【註】臣瓚曰：鋊，銅屑也。摩錢漫面，以取其屑，更以鑄錢。師古曰：鋊，音浴。又【南宋·孔覬·鑄錢議】五銖錢，周郭其上下，令不可磨取鋊。【五音譜】磨礱漸銷曰鋊。今俗謂磨光曰磨鋊。　又【集韻】餘封切，音容。鉤鋊，取炭器。

鋊字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

鋊字的起名意思

古代钩鼎耳和出炉炭的器具。

yù
Copper shavings: "Today, the half-two-dollar law weighs four baht, and the money is taken by rape or theft."
The utensils are gradually polished and lose their sharp edges or edges: the kitchen knife will not be bad if it is cut, and the scissors will cut continuously. The stone mill has gone bad.
Ancient utensils for hooking tripod ears and baking charcoal.

[Su Ji 1] [Golden Word Department] 　鋊; Kangxi strokes: 15; Page number: page 1307 02
[Tang Yun] Yu Yuqie [Jiyun] [Rhyme] Yu Yuqie, sound desire. [Said the text] You can hook the tripod and the charcoal. From the sound of Jingu. [Guang Yun] Charcoal hook also.　[Said Wen] One said copper scraps. [Previous Han·Shihuozhi] Trapeze or steal money to obtain gluten. [Note] Chen Zan said: enamel, copper scraps also. Spread money to get the scraps, and even to make money. Shi Gu said: 鋊, sound bath. Also [Southern Song Dynasty·Confucius·Court Money Discussion】Five baht money, Zhou Guoqi up and down, make it indelible. [Pentagram] The milled hulls are gradually sold, and they are called 鋊. Nowadays, it is said that polishing is called polishing.　[Jiyun] Yu Fengqie, sound volume. Hook up, take charcoal device.
